sections.transition_to_message: We'll start by asking you some questions about your skin.

details.text: Have you had this type of rash before?
Was your eczema diagnosed by a doctor or other healthcare professional?
When did your current rash start?
When did you first have a rash like your current one?

answers.text: When I was a young child

details.text: Is your current rash similar to your typical eczema rash?
What about your current rash is different than usual?
Which areas of your body are currently affected by rash?
Have you noticed any changes with your fingernails or toenails?
How many fingernails are affected?
How many toenails are affected?
Which nail changes have you noticed?

popup.text: Small pinprick holes that appear on the nail surface.

details.text: Do these nail changes occur with your rash?

answers.text: No, they seem unrelated to the rash
Yes, they come and go with the rash

details.text: How long have you been experiencing nail problems?
Since it began, has your rash spread or receded?

answers.text: Yes, it covers more area now
Yes, it covers less area now

details.text: Is your rash mostly located in skin creases (e.g. in elbow creases or behind knees)?
Do you have a rash in any of the following places?
Do you have a rash in any of the following places?
Is your rash itchy?
How severe is your itchiness?
What is your current rash like?
Are you scratching the rash?

answers.text: No, and I don’t want to

details.text: Is discomfort from your rash causing you trouble sleeping?
Is discomfort from your rash causing you trouble in your daily activities?
Are you still able to complete your basic activities of daily living, such as walking, eating, and caring for yourself?
Are you experiencing any of the following symptoms?
Have you noticed anything that causes you to have a rash or that makes your rash worse?
Give more details related to what seems to make the rash worse.
Have you noticed anything that prevents you from getting a rash or that makes your rash better?
Give more details related to what seems to make the rash better.
Have you ever lived or traveled somewhere where your typical rash was better or worse?
Give more details related to where you lived or traveled to that caused the rash to improve or worsen.
Eczema can be frustrating. How has your mood been?
Have you ever had skin reactions to fake jewelry or nickel products?

popup.text: Examples: jewelry, belts, utensils, tools, keys, pots and pans, and even some topical products like eyeshadow.

details.text: Please tell us about all of the shampoos, detergents, cosmetics, lotions, and other skincare or haircare products that you use:
Are you currently pregnant or planning to become pregnant?
Which trimester are you currently in?

popup.text: 1st Trimester: Week 1 thru Week 12; 2nd Trimester: Week 13 to Week 27; 3rd Trimester: Week 28 to Birth

details.text: Are you currently breastfeeding?

sections.transition_to_message: Now we'll take photos for your doctor to make a diagnosis.

screens.header_title: Take photos of the areas currently affected by rash.
screens.header_summary: Your doctor will use these to make a diagnosis.

details.text: Face
Arms
Hands
Fingernails
Other Location

screens.header_title: Take photos of an area where you aren't experiencing rash.
screens.header_summary: Your doctor will use these to make a diagnosis.

details.text: Add Location

sections.transition_to_message: Now we'll ask you some questions about your past medical history.

details.text: Apart from eczema, do you have any dermatologic conditions?
Do you have diabetes?
Have you had a hemoglobin A1c level checked in the past year?
What was your most recent hemoglobin A1c level?
Are your fingerstick blood glucose measurements normally between 100 and 200 mg/dL?
Have you ever had trouble with your thyroid gland function?
Describe the problems you have had with your thyroid.
Do you have any of the following medical conditions?
Describe the autoimmune condition you have
Do you currently have AIDS (CD4 count <200)?
Do you have a clinic that you follow up with regularly to manage your HIV?
Do you have any other current medical conditions or important past medical history? Anything for which you see a doctor or take medication is useful to know.
Describe any other medical information you think is relevant for the doctor.
Do you smoke cigarettes or another form of tobacco?
Do you regularly get a large amount of sun exposure or other UV exposure (e.g. tanning beds)?
Do you have any pets or frequent animal exposures?
How often do you bathe or shower?
What is the temperature like where you spend most of your time?

answers.text: Fairly consistent, not too hot or cold
Sometimes very hot or very cold

details.text: Describe the temperature of the place where you spend most of your time.
What is the humidity like where you spend most of your time?
Describe the humidity of the place where you spend most of your time.
Do you have any occupations or hobbies at which you spend a good deal of time (e.g. where do you work)?
Describe your occupation or hobby at which you spend a good deal of time.
Do any of your first-degree relatives [link to explain this means parents, siblings, or children] have any of the following conditions?
Have you already seen a doctor or other healthcare professional for this rash?
Which type of healthcare provider(s) have you previously seen for your rash?

answers.text: Internal medicine, family practice, general practitioner

details.text: What diagnosis were you given for your rash?

popup.text: A type of eczema that causes dry skin, intense itching, and a red, raised rash.
A pink or red itchy rash in response to an allergen (e.g., poison ivy), or repeated contact with a harsh substance (e.g., washing hands too much).

details.text: Did <parent_answer_text> improve your rash?
Would you like to continue taking <parent_answer_text>?

answers.text: Yes, and I have a current prescription
Yes, and I need a new prescription

details.text: Did your provider prescribe you any of the following medications or treatments?
Were you prescribed any other medications or therapies?
Please tell us which other medications or therapies you were prescribed and whether they were useful:
Did your provider do any testing of your rash (e.g. skin scraping, biopsy, or blood tests)?

popup.text: A biopsy is a procedure to remove a piece of tissue or a sample of cells from your body so that it can be analyzed in a laboratory.

details.text: What other testing did your provider do?:
Please tell us anything else relevant about your previous visit(s)
Have you tried any treatments for your eczema that weren’t prescribed by a healthcare professional?
Which treatments have you tried for your eczema?
Please tell us about any medications or herbal supplements that you take regularly
